intro: Xanthobrychis bobrovii, commonly known as the Bobrovii sandwort, is a rare and small evergreen shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and produces small, yellowish-green flowers during the spring season. The plant thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has small, leathery leaves that help reduce water loss, and it is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
